__NOEDITSECTION__ __NOTOC__ '''''SMW+ 1.5.6 has been successfully installed!'''''
== About SMW+ == {| style="width: 97%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Mainpage.gif|Mainpage.gif|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | SMW+ is a semantic enterprise wiki that is distributed by Ontoprise GmbH, Karlsruhe, Germany. This tool is well suited for organizations or teams dealing with heterogeneous and informal workflows and offers a rich feature set to create, share, publish and re-use knowledge contained in content. Ontoprise develops extensions to MediaWiki and carefully picks other useful extensions and, if having passed our quality assurance procedure, casts them into SMW+.
SMW+ includes Semantic MediaWiki (developed by Markus Kr√∂tzsch and Denny Vrandecic at the university of Karlsruhe) and the halo-Extension which is developed by Ontoprise in the HALO project, a Paul G. Allen initiative which is sponsored by his Seattle-based Vulcan Inc. (''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/overview Read more...]'')
'''[[SMW+ 1.5|Overview of SMW+]]''' |} == Getting started == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="middle" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Trafficlight.png|center|65px|Trafficlight.png|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | To get you started with SMW+, we included a guide that features step-by-step instructions about creating and using annotations in your SMW+ installation. This guide shows you how to annotate a wiki article and how to query for these annotations. '''[[Getting started|See how to create your first annotation with SMW+]]''' |} == Getting help == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="250" align="center" | [[Image:Join.png|Join.png|link=]] | valign="top" width="auto" align="left" | Find the complete '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:SMW%2B user manual for SMW+]''' Visit the SMW+ User Community, which is hosted by ontoprise, Vulcan Inc. and Monitor. Join in our regular user group meetings in north america and europe. *'''Share your experience:''' debate in the online forum and learn how others are using SMW+ *'''Learn to apply and customize:''' browse the comprehensive user manuals, read about the wealth of business applications and best practices and find out how to deploy, customize and integrate SMW+ *'''Contribute to the project:''' add and publish own materials and discuss with the engineering team or even contribute software '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Semantic_MediaWiki_User_Group Enter the user forum] '''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwbugs/ Report Bugs]''' ''(Read this before filing bugs: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:How_to_report_a_bug Help:How to report a bug])'' |} == Getting More Information == {| style="width: 90%" border="0" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="5" |- | valign="top" width="75%" align="left" | *You can get more information on SMW+ [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com here], including history and documentation *You can contact people from ontoprise via [http://www.ontoprise.de this page] *If you have any comments or questions, please feel free to contact us via smw@ontoprise.de or on SMW+ Discussion Board: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwboard/index.php http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwboard/index.php] *Don't forget to visit the website from colleagues at the University of Karlsruhe: [http://semantic-mediawiki.org http://semantic-mediawiki.org] |} ---- '''Now go semantic and have fun!'''

{{Category}} __NOTOC__ __NORICHEDITOR__ __NOEDITSECTION__ == Information about this category == [[Rationale::Categories are used as universal "tags" for articles, describing that the article belongs to a certain group of articles.]] ;What are categories? :Categories are a means to classify articles according to certain criteria. For example, by adding <tt><nowiki>[[Category:Cities]]</nowiki></tt> to an article, the page is tagged as describing a city. SMW+ can use this information to generate a list of all cities in a wiki, and thus help users to browse the information. ;How to create a category? :Open the [[Special:OntologyBrowser]] to create a category: [[Special:OntologyBrowser|open the OntologyBrowser]]. ;Icon used for categories: :[[Category has icon::Image:Smw_plus_category_icon_100x100.gif]] ;Exclude category-pages from opening in a semantic form? :[[No automatic formedit::true]] ;List of all categories :Open the [[Special:OntologyBrowser]] to get a list of all categories in this Wiki: [[Special:OntologyBrowser|open the OntologyBrowser]]. [[Category:Wiki part|Wiki_part]] {{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} {{Content hash |value=a8fd61c09a3f96c4b4ec109c3b17f656 }}

{{Category}} __NOTOC__ __NORICHEDITOR__ __NOEDITSECTION__ == Information about this category == [[Rationale::Super category of all basic parts of the Wiki-content: category, property, form and template]] [[No automatic formedit::true| ]] [[Category:Entity]] {{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} {{Content hash|value=1147b48c7c2a46172d3420b21d60d05c}}

{{Category}} __NOTOC__ __NORICHEDITOR__ __NOEDITSECTION__ == Information about this category == [[Rationale::This category is used to allow easy bookkeeping of manually created Forms. You should always assign your manually created Forms to this category. ]] ;What are manually created forms? :Forms are a means to enforce users to enter specific data in articles. ;How to create a form? :Forms follow a convention that the name is prefixed with "Form:", assigning it to that namespace; besides this, you can create them like any other wiki page. :{{NoteInText|SMW+ creates forms for you automatically on the fly!}} :'''Please read here about the [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Automatic_Semantic_Forms_extension Automatic Semantic Forms] feature: read about the [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Automatic_Semantic_Forms_extension Automatic Semantic Forms extension]. ;Icon used for forms: :[[Category has icon::Image:smw_plus_form_icon_100x100.gif]] ;Exclude form-pages from opening in a semantic form? :[[No automatic formedit::true]] [[Category:Wiki part]] {{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} {{Content hash}}

{{Category}} __NOTOC__ __NORICHEDITOR__ __NOEDITSECTION__ == Information about this category == [[Rationale::This category contains all properties.]] ;What are properties? :Properties are a means of storing semantic data in SMW+. For example, by adding <tt><nowiki>[[population::3,396,990]]</nowiki></tt> to an article about a city, then this knowledge is available to the computer. SMW+ can use this information to generate a sorted list of all cities having a population number. ;How to create a property? :Open the [[Special:OntologyBrowser]], select a category and add a property to it: [[Special:OntologyBrowser|open the OntologyBrowser]]. ;Icon used for properties: :[[Category has icon::Image:smw_plus_property_icon_100x100.gif]] ;Exclude property-pages from opening in a semantic form? :[[No automatic formedit::true]] ;List of all properties :Open the [[Special:OntologyBrowser]] to get a list of all properties in this Wiki: [[Special:OntologyBrowser|open the OntologyBrowser]]. [[Category:Wiki part|Wiki_part]] {{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} {{Content hash |value=b61743a34c2c7c9a2a4eb7c121808888 }}

{{Category}} __NOTOC__ __NORICHEDITOR__ __NOEDITSECTION__ == Information about this category == [[Rationale::You should always assign your templates to this category.]] ;What are templates? :Templates are standard wiki pages whose content is designed to be transcluded (embedded) inside other pages. ;How to create a template? :Templates follow a convention that the name is prefixed with "Template:", assigning it to that namespace; besides this, you can create them like any other wiki page. ;Icon used for templates: :[[Category has icon::Image:Smw plus template icon 100x100.gif]] ;Exclude templates from opening in a semantic form? :[[No automatic formedit::true]] ;List of all templates: :Open the special page [[Special:AllPages]] and filter for all pages in the namespace "Template": open the [[Special:AllPages]]. [[Category:Wiki part]] {{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} {{Content hash|value=}}

== About SMW+ == ==== What is SMW<sup>+</sup>? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic enterprise wiki that is distributed by Ontoprise GmbH, Karlsruhe, Germany. SMW<sup>+</sup> is well suited for organizations or teams dealing with heterogeneous and informal workflows. SMW<sup>+</sup> offers a rich feature set to create, share, publish and re-use knowledge contained in content. Ontoprise develops extensions to MediaWiki and carefully picks other useful extensions and, if having passed our quality assurance procedure, casts them into SMW<sup>+</sup>. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/SMW%2B ''Read more...'']
==== Who is Ontoprise? ====
Ontoprise GmbH based in Karlsruhe, Germany, is a leading software provider of ontology-based solutions. Ontologies structure relevant know-how of your company, no matter how complex the relations are and how widely the information is scattered throughout the enterprise. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Ontoprise ''Read more...'']
==== What is "Project Halo"? ====
Vulcan Inc, based in Seattle, has established the long-term research program Project Halo to develop a ‚ÄúDigital Aristotle‚Äù that can serve as a comprehensive computer knowledge base and problem-solving system for natural sciences. Ontoprise GmbH has been elected as Vulcan's prime contractor to develop an extension (named "halo extension") to Semantic MediaWiki for Project Halo. The extended Semantic MediaWiki is serving as a web-based collaboration tool for the user-friendly and low-cost acquisition of scientific knowledge for Project Halo. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/project_halo ''Read more...'']
==== Why are you claiming SMW<sup>+</sup> is a "semantic enterprise wiki"? ====
A wiki is a collection of web pages designed to enable anyone who accesses it to contribute or modify content quickly. Enterprises are adopting wikis more and more over the last years to make use of the wiki principle. Compared with other enterprise wikis SMW<sup>+</sup> ranks under the top three enterprise wikis. SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic enterprise wiki allowing casual users to include structured data into articles and, thus, organize articles in a graspable manner and to instantaneously exploit the data. Therefore SMW<sup>+</sup> is a full blown knowledge management system combining a wiki's social authoring approach with proven semantic technology. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Enterprise_semantic_wiki ''Read more...'']
==== How does SMW<sup>+</sup> compare to other enterprise wikis? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is providing a competitive level for requirements requested by professional users in the fields of reliability in daily operation, ease of procurement, commercial support contracts, minimal training efforts, access control and scalability. Thanks to its semantic technologies SMW<sup>+</sup> clearly outpaces non-semantic wikis in the fields of interoperability and expressivity. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Comparison_of_SMW%2B_with_other_enterprise_wikis ''Read more...'']
==== How does SMW<sup>+</sup> compare to other semantic wikis? ====
SMW<sup>+</sup> is a semantic wiki since it heavily employs semantic technologies (i.e. typed links, taxonomy and inferencing). SMW<sup>+</sup> outpaces other semantic wikis with respect to requirements requested by professional users (ease of procurement, commercial support contracts, interoperability). Thanks to its semantic technologies SMW<sup>+</sup> competes with other semantic wikis regarding expressivity level but it offers the best trade off between expressivity and computability. Also, SMW<sup>+</sup> users are efficiently supported with usability features to efficiently make use of the high level of expressivity. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Comparison_of_SMW%2B_with_other_semantic_wikis ''Read more...'']
==== Do you provide professional support? ====
When enterprises consider deploying a wiki then the availability of commercial support is imperative. Ontoprise accounts for the special needs of commercial implementations of SMW<sup>+</sup> (and Semantic MediaWiki) by offering technical support contracts, training for administrators and end-users and consulting, custom software development and system integration. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/Professional_support_contracts ''Read more...'']
==== What does "GPL" mean? ====
SMW+ is open source software. It is licenced under the GPL General Public License. This license grants you the right to distribute SMW<sup>+</sup> in compliance with the conditions which are named in the GPL text. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/GPL ''Read more...'']
==== What is the "Halo extension"? ====
Seattle-based Vulcan Inc has selected ontoprise GmbH as its prime contractor to develop an extension to Semantic MediaWiki for Project Halo; the extension is named Halo extension. The Halo extension improves Semantic MediaWiki in terms of interoperability and usability compared to competing semantic wikis. SMW<sup>+</sup>, ontoprise's business-ready distribution of Semantic MediaWiki including essential enhancements to it, comprises the Halo extension, too. [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Faq/halo_extension ''Read more...'']
==== Where can I get more information? ====
You can browse the SMW<sup>+</sup> community web site to find user manuals and examples of applications: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com http://smwforum.ontoprise.com].
Or simply drop us an email: [mailto:smw@ontoprise.de smw@ontoprise.de].
{{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} [[Rationale::A simple promo article explaining what SMW+ and project halo are.| ]] {{Content hash|value=921b2a0671129b5106b33e9313370828}}

This page provides an overview and access to the most important features of SMW+. == Editing
== {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_WYSIWYG.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_annotationmode.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_semantictoolbar.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Easy Editing and Formatting === | align="left" valign="top" | === User-Friendly Annotation === | align="left" valign="top" | === Inspecting Semantic Annotations === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The WYSIWYG editor can be accessed via the '''tab ''Edit''''' at an article's page. With the WYSIWYG editor users can intuitively format text, create tables, embed images and other media into an article without having to cope with the wiki source text.
| align="left" valign="top" | The Advanced Annotation Mode provides a user-friendly method for annotating articles in the wiki. It can be accessed via the ''''annotate' link''' within the ''More'' tab and lets you annotate an article without the need to directly edit the plain wiki text. Instead, annotations can be made in-place by simply marking the text and assigning a value to it. | align="left" valign="top" | The Semantic Toolbar enables the easy creation of category annotations, property annotations and property attributes and frees the user from having to know the specific wiki text mark-up. It can be accessed via the '''Semantic Toolbar''' button in the WYSIWYG editor and is displayed alongside the text.
|} == Creating new articles == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="middle" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[File:SMWplus151 createnewpage.png|250px|SMWplus151 createnewpage.png]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[File:SMWplus151 semanticforms.png|250px|SMWplus151 semanticforms.png]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Creating new pages === | align="left" valign="top" | === Adding Data with Semantic Forms === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The dialog guides you through the creation process of a new page. You can choose if you like to create the page either with an editor or predefined forms. Just click on '''Create New Article''' in the header of a page.
| align="left" valign="top" | Semantic Forms allow users to add and edit data using simple forms. It is suitable for recurring, structured data such as meeting minutes or data about persons and events. Choose one of the forms on the left hand side and start entering data.
|} == Querying == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_enhancedretrieval.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_queryinterface.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_tsc.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Powerful Searching === | align="left" valign="top" | === Dynamic Querying === | align="left" valign="top" | === Storing and Retrieving RDF Data === | align="left" valign="top" |
|- | align="left" valign="top" | The search capability of SMW+ is powered by the Enhanced Retrieval component. It is based on the state-of-the-art search engine Lucene (which is also used in the Wikipedia search) and enables users to better find relevant contents scattered across a wiki. Just type a term in Search field in the header or go to '''[[Special:Search|Specialpage Search]]''' | align="left" valign="top" | The Query interface helps you to exploit the full power of Semantic MediaWiki's query mechanism. It provides a graphical user interface that supports you in building such queries in an intuitive manner. Access this tool via the '''[[Special:QueryInterface|Specialpage QueryInterface]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | Triple stores are special databases that allow to store and retrieve RDF data efficiently. With a triple store enabled SMW+ you can query the knowledge base directly within the wiki or from remote by using SPARQL queries. The latter method is useful if other applications shall exploit the semantically annotated data residing in your wiki. The '''[[Special:TSA|special page TSA]]''' helps you to administrate the wiki/triplestore connection.
''(Learn more about attaching a triple store to SMW+ here: [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:TripleStoreConnector_Basic Help:Working with Triple store])'' |} == Curating == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_ontologybrowser.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_gardening.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_haloacl.png|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Navigating through Ontology === | align="left" valign="top" | === Maintaining Quality === | align="left" valign="top" | === Managing User Rights === | align="left" valign="top" |
|- | align="left" valign="top" | The Ontology Browser gives a fast and precise overview of the wiki's ontology (i.e. its semantic knowledge model). It allows users to navigate through the category and property hierarchy and to inspect instances and their characteristics. It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:OntologyBrowser|Specialpage OntologyBrowser]]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | The Gardening tool suite of SMW+ is a set of programs that allow you to improve the quality of your wiki. With the help of the Gardening Framework you can check the knowledge base for inconsistencies and detect anomalies such as undefined entities, pages without annotations or empty categories. It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:Gardening|Specialpage Gardening]]''' if the [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Semantic_Gardening_Extension Semantic Gardening extension] is installed.
| align="left" valign="top" | With the Access Control Lists component you can restrict the access to different elements of your wiki for single users or entire user groups. It enables the protection of namespaces (e.g. the namespace of 'special' pages), categories (e.g. for articles belonging to the category 'protected') and single article pages (e.g. for the article 'internal administration'). It can be accessed via the '''[[Special:HaloACL|Specialpage Halo ACL]]''' if the [http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:Access_Control_List_extension Access Control List extension] is installed.
| align="left" valign="top" |
|} == Connectivity and Importing Features == {| cellspacing="5" cellpadding="10" border="0" align="center" style="width: 200px; height: 122px;" |- | align="middle" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:Excel install1.jpg|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:SMWplus151_dataimport.png|250px]] | align="center" width="25%" valign="middle" | [[Image:Project install1.jpg|250px]] |- | align="left" valign="top" | === Exporting Data to Excel === | align="left" valign="top" | === Importing External Data === | align="left" valign="top" | === Synchronizing Data with MS Project === |- | align="left" valign="top" | The MS Excel Bridge allows you to query an SMW+ knowledge base and import the results into Excel spreadsheets. This way you can e. g. easily transfer project data gathered in your wiki and reuse it for further calculations in Excel. The client is shipped as a separate Windows installer for easy deployment.
'''[http://shop.ontoprise.com/ Download MS Excel Bridge]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php?title=Help:Administration_of_MS_Excel_Bridge How to install MS Excel Bridge]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:MS_Excel_Bridge Documentation]'''
| align="left" valign="top" | This feature allows you to call external web services from the wiki and integrate the web service results directly into your wiki articles. This way you can e.g. hook in the Bugzilla web service, in order to include bug entries from Bugzilla in those wiki pages that describe your affected software components. You can see '''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Example:Library_of_webservices examples of the web services here]'''. | align="left" valign="top" | With the MS Project Connector you can easily export your project data from the Wiki into your MS Project client. This is especially usefull when you use the Wiki to collaboratively set up the project and you move then into the project performance phase to monitor the progress. The client is shipped as a separate Windows installer for easy deployment.
'''[http://shop.ontoprise.com/ Download MS Project Connector]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php?title=Help:Installing_MS_Project_Connector How to install MS Project Connector]'''
'''[http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Help:MS_Project_Connector Documentation]''' |}
{{Part of bundle|value=Smwplus}} [[Rationale::Promo article explaining the main features of SMW+.| ]] {{Content hash|value=f7cb8f8e3cd2c4d956f39bb12c63409f}}

= Ontoprise License For SMW+ = {{NoteInText|This copy of "SMW+ Community Edition" is not registered with ontoprise GmbH. Nevertheless, you can use it for free. If you require warranty or product support from ontoprise GmbH then you would be well-advised to purchase a product key which upgrades this installation to "SMW+ Professional".}}

Benefits of upgrading to SMW+ Professional

With purchasing a product key you get a reliable, quality-assured, and supported application fit to run in any demanding environment. ;What do you get from ontoprise GmbH? * Access to the ontoprise support team (up to three support tickets), * Warranty in case of software defects (for one calendar year), and * Extended support plan (optional, for an additional fee). ;How to upgrade to SMW+ Professional? Buy a product key to upgrade this installation to SMW+ Professional: [[File:Button_Purchase.png|link=http://smwforum.ontoprise.com/smwforum/index.php/Buy_SMW%2B_Professional|Purchase a product key]] ;How to install a product key? After purchasing SMW+ professional you will get an email containing your personal copy of SMW+ professional and a product key. To activate the product key for this installation, please upload the product key here: [[File:Button_Upload.png|link=Special:Upload|upload the product key]]
{{NoteInText|If you have purchased "SMW+ Professional" and this article is still displayed after installation then this installation is not activated yet. Please activate your installation by installing the product key (see above).}}
